snippet: The Jihad Museum honors Afghans who fought the Soviets in the 1970s and 1980s, a bloody time in the nation’s history that some believe is likely to repeat itself.
abstract: Herat Journal; Jihad Museum in Herat, Afghanistan, is both temple to mujahedeen heroes who fought Soviets in 1970s and 80s and memorial to those killed in fighting; many Afghans also view it as documenting violent time that they believe is likely to repeat itself after end of NATO combat mission in 2014.
lead_paragraph: The Jihad Museum honors Afghans who fought the Soviets in the 1970s and 1980s, a bloody time in the nation’s history that some believe is likely to repeat itself.

headline.seo: Afghan Museum Recalls a Previous War
headline.main: Where War Still Echoes, Recalling Earlier Battles
headline.print_headline: Where War Still Echoes, Recalling Earlier Battles
